trial_identification.studytitle: A Study With Aleglitazar in Patients With a Recent Acute Coronary Syndrome and Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Safety and Efficacy Study to Evaluate the Potential of Aleglitazar to Reduce Cardiovascular Risk in Coronary Heart Disease (CHD) Patients With a Recent Acute Coronary Syndrome (ACS) Event and Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (T2D)

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Aleglitazar Treatment: drugs - Placebo
Experimental: Aleglitazar -
Placebo Comparator: Placebo -
Treatment: drugs: Aleglitazar aleglitazar 150 micrograms po daily
Treatment: drugs: Placebo placebo control po daily

primaryOutcome.outcome: Effect on cardiovascular death, non-fatal myocardial infarction and non-fatal stroke

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Glycemic control, lipoprotein profile, blood pressure, biomarkers of cardiovascular risk
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Throughout study, months 1, 3, 6, 9, 12 and then every 6 months thereafter

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Adults >18 years of age
- Type 2 diabetes mellitus
- Hospitalization for ACS event and randomization between hospital discharge and 8 weeks after the ACS index event (day of hospitalization)
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Estimated glomerular filtration rate <45 mL/min/1.73m2
- Concomitant treatment with a thiazolidinedione and/or fibrate
- Triglycerides >400 mg/dL
- Anaemia
- Symptomatic congestive heart failure classified as New York Heart Association (NYHA) class II-IV (France and Germany: Symptomatic congestive heart failure classified as NYHA class I-IV)

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This double-blind, parallel, two-arm study will evaluate the potential to reduce cardiovascular risk, the tolerability and long-term safety profile of aleglitazar compared to placebo on top of standard care in patients with recent acute coronary syndrome (ACS) and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Patients will be randomized to receive either aleglitazar or placebo once daily as oral doses. The study will last until at least 950 events occur, but time on study treatment will be for at least 2.5 years.
